tier_1.name: Museum Quality I
tier_1.description: Digging up Uncommon Artifacts will become more likely.

tier_1.name: Unpeatable
tier_1.description: Digging up Peat, Sod, and Clay will sometimes drop double the usual amount.

tier_1.name: Sunken Secrets
tier_1.description: Dive spots can now contain Sunken Artifacts.

tier_1.name: Western Ruins Scholar
tier_1.description: An additional Dig Site will appear daily at the Western Ruins.

tier_2.name: Sunken Treasure
tier_2.description: Treasure chests are more likely to appear when diving.

tier_2.name: Stoneturner
tier_2.description: Artifacts will sometimes drop from breaking Rocks in the Mines.

tier_2.name: Eastern Road Scholar
tier_2.description: An additional Dig Site will appear daily on the Eastern Road.

tier_2.name: Pursuit
tier_2.description: Digging up Peat, Sod, or Clay increases your chances of finding an Uncommon or Rare Artifact the next time.

tier_3.name: Back in Vogue
tier_3.description: Artifacts will now sell for 25% more tesserae.

tier_3.name: Natural Beauty
tier_3.description: Biome Furniture Recipes will sometimes drop from Dig Sites in the Mines.

tier_3.name: Well Placed
tier_3.description: Out of Place Artifacts will sometimes drop from Dig Sites in the overworld.

tier_3.name: Museum Quality Two
tier_3.description: Digging up Rare Artifacts will become more likely.

tier_4.name: Former Farmers
tier_4.description: A dig site will now appear daily on your farm, with a new artifact set to collect.

tier_4.name: Museum Quality III
tier_4.description: Digging up Legendary Artifacts will become more likely.

tier_4.name: Back In Vogue II
tier_4.description: Artifacts now sell for an additional 25% more tesserae.

tier_1.name: Copper Expert
tier_1.description: The amount of Copper Ore required to craft Copper Ingots will be reduced by 1.

tier_1.name: Time Sensitive
tier_1.description: The Craft Time for all blacksmithing recipes will be reduced by 10 minutes.

tier_1.name: Sharp Blacksmithing
tier_1.description: Crafting a Weapon will occasionally result in a bonus Sharp Infusion, which grants it an additional +1 Attack Power.

tier_1.name: Fortified Blacksmithing
tier_1.description: Crafting Armor will occasionally result in a bonus Fortified Infusion, which grants you an additional +4 HP when worn.

tier_2.name: Iron Expert
tier_2.description: The amount of Iron Ore required to craft Iron Ingots will be reduced by 1.

tier_2.name: Time Sensitive II
tier_2.description: The Craft Time for all blacksmithing recipes will reduce by an additional 10 minutes, bringing the total reduction to 20 minutes.

tier_2.name: Leech Blacksmithing
tier_2.description: Crafting a Weapon will occasionally result in a bonus Leech Infusion, which restores 1 HP each time it's used to attack a Monster.

tier_2.name: Lightweight Blacksmithing
tier_2.description: Crafting a Tool will occasionally result in a bonus Lightweight Infusion, occasionally dropping Stamina orbs on use.

tier_3.name: Silver Expert
tier_3.description: The amount of Silver Ore required to craft Silver Ingots will be reduced by 1.

tier_3.name: Hasty Blacksmithing
tier_3.description: Crafting Armor will occasionally result in a bonus Hasty Infusion, which grants you an additional 4% Speed Boost when worn.

tier_3.name: Time Sensitive III
tier_3.description: The Craft Time for all blacksmithing recipes will reduce by another 10 minutes, bringing the total reduction to 30 minutes.

tier_3.name: Empowered
tier_3.description: Crafting a Tool, Weapon, or Armor will be more likely to result in an available Infused version.

tier_4.name: Empowered II
tier_4.description: Crafting a Tool, Weapon, or Armor will be a bit more likely to result in an available Infused version than before.

tier_4.name: Gold Expert
tier_4.description: The amount of Gold Ore required to craft Gold Ingots will be reduced by 1.

tier_4.name: Tireless Blacksmithing
tier_4.description: Crafting Armor will occasionally result in a bonus Tireless Infusion, which grants you an additional +4 Stamina when worn.

tier_4.name: Time Sensitive IV
tier_4.description: The Craft Time for all blacksmithing recipes will reduce by yet another 10 minutes, bringing the total reduction to 40 minutes.

tier_1.name: Waste Not Want Not
tier_1.description: Cooking a dish will occasionally return one of its ingredients afterward.

tier_1.name: Time To Eat
tier_1.description: The Cook Time for all cooking recipes will be reduced by 10 minutes.

tier_1.name: Restorative Cooking
tier_1.description: Cooking a dish will occasionally result in a bonus Restorative Infusion, which grants an HP & Stamina Regen buff when consumed.

tier_1.name: Taste Maker
tier_1.description: Cooking Recipes will sometimes drop from Treasure Chests in the Mines.

tier_2.name: Seasoned
tier_2.description: Finding Uncommon or rarer Forageables will become more likely.

tier_2.name: Time To Eat II
tier_2.description: The Cook Time for all cooking recipes will be reduced by an additional 10 minutes, bringing the total reduction to 20 minutes.

tier_2.name: Award Winning
tier_2.description: Cooked Dishes given as Liked Gifts will reward more Heart Points than before.

tier_2.name: Likable Cooking
tier_2.description: Cooking a dish will occasionally result in a bonus Likable Infusion, turning the item into a Universally Liked gift.

tier_3.name: Speedy Cooking
tier_3.description: Cooking a dish will occasionally result in a bonus Speedy Infusion, which grants a Speed Boost buff when consumed.

tier_3.name: Dinner for Two
tier_3.description: Cooking a dish will sometimes create a bonus extra dish.

tier_3.name: A Way to the Heart
tier_3.description: Cooked Dishes given as Loved Gifts will reward more Heart Points than before.

tier_3.name: Time to Eat III
tier_3.description: The Cook Time for all cooking recipes will be reduced by another 10 minutes, bringing the total reduction to 30 minutes.

tier_4.name: Lovable Cooking
tier_4.description: Cooking a dish will occasionally result in a bonus Lovable Infusion, turning the item into a Universally Loved gift.

tier_4.name: Snacktime
tier_4.description: The time it takes to eat has been reduced by half.

tier_4.name: Caffeine Crimes
tier_4.description: Consuming an item with the Speedy infusion will now double both its speed boost and the buff's duration.

tier_4.name: Magical Meals
tier_4.description: Cooking a Four star dish and above will occasionally result in a bonus Mana Infusion, which restores a mana orb when consumed.

tier_1.name: Prepared Picker
tier_1.description: Harvesting a Forageable will occasionally drop a Seed version, if it can be grown.

tier_1.name: A Day Well Spent
tier_1.description: Going to bed with zero stamina gives a stamina boost the next day.

tier_1.name: Green Thumb
tier_1.description: Planting a Seed will sometimes also Water the soil of the targeted tile.

tier_1.name: Refreshing
tier_1.description: Watering a crop will sometimes refund the Stamina used.

tier_2.name: Bountiful
tier_2.description: Watering a crop will occasionally drop a Seed version of it.

tier_2.name: Heavy Duty
tier_2.description: Tilling soil will sometimes drop a piece of Stone or Wood.

tier_2.name: Well Watered
tier_2.description: Watered crops will occasionally retain their water through the next day.

tier_2.name: Nice Swing
tier_2.description: Grants a chance that tilling refunds the stamina it uses.

tier_3.name: Living off the Land
tier_3.description: Harvesting a crop will occasionally drop a cooked dish that uses the crop.

tier_3.name: Superb Sower
tier_3.description: You can now charge your seeds to spread them across a wider area.

tier_3.name: Harvest Time
tier_3.description: Slow-Growing crops now reach their first-time harvest a day earlier.

tier_3.name: Prize Winning
tier_3.description: Harvesting crops will occasionally drop coins based on 5% of their selling price.

tier_4.name: Sickle Sword
tier_4.description: You can now use your sword to harvest crops quickly.

tier_4.name: Ornamental
tier_4.description: Harvesting a crop or forageable will sometimes drop a recipe teaching you how to make an ornamental furniture version of the plant.

tier_4.name: Perfect Pollinators
tier_4.description: Legendary bugs will now appear more often.

tier_1.name: Weedline Watcher
tier_1.description: Fishing up Junk will become less likely.

tier_1.name: Aquatic Antiquities
tier_1.description: Aquatic Artifacts can sometimes be fished up.

tier_1.name: Appealing Reeling
tier_1.description: Fish will become attracted to your Bobber from a greater range.

tier_1.name: Catch of the Day
tier_1.description: Catching a Fish will sometimes refund the Stamina used.

tier_2.name: School Crasher
tier_2.description: Swimming into a Fish School will drop half its contained items without spending Stamina.

tier_2.name: Lucky Haul
tier_2.description: Catching a fish will sometimes drop double the amount.

tier_2.name: Perfect Catch
tier_2.description: Uncommon and rare fish will become more common.

tier_2.name: Unexpected Haul
tier_2.description: Treasure Boxes will become more likely to appear when Fishing.

tier_3.name: Full Class I
tier_3.description: Fish schools will all contain an additional Fish.

tier_3.name: Legendary
tier_3.description: Legendary fish can now appear when the season and weather conditions are right.

tier_3.name: Treasure Trove
tier_3.description: You can no longer catch Wooden Treasure Boxes, and you are now more likely to catch a higher tier of Treasure Box.

tier_3.name: Weedline Watcher II
tier_3.description: Fishing up Junk will become even less likely.

tier_4.name: Appealing Reeling II
tier_4.description: Fish will become attracted to your Bobber from an even greater range.

tier_4.name: Frenzy
tier_4.description: Catching a fish will occasionally cause a fish school to spawn nearby.

tier_4.name: What a Catch
tier_4.description: Fish have a chance of dropping coins worth 10% of their value when caught.

tier_4.name: Lucky Haul II
tier_4.description: Catching a fish is even more likely to drop double the amount of the fish.

tier_1.name: Feeding Frenzy
tier_1.description: Hay and Grass Seed drop at double the usual amount from Cutting Grass.

tier_1.name: Close Bond
tier_1.description: Animals that have been Pet and Fed for the day will receive an extra Heart Point increase.

tier_1.name: Barnyard Bounty
tier_1.description: Chickens and Cows will sometimes drop extra Produce.

tier_1.name: Currency Of Care
tier_1.description: When animals eat crops, either by hand feeding or by grazing, they will drop the currency Shiny Beads.

tier_2.name: Currency of Care II
tier_2.description: Animals that have been Pet and Fed for the day will sometimes drop Shiny Bead the next day in addition to their regular Produce.

tier_2.name: Feed Prepper
tier_2.description: The Craft Time for all animal feed is reduced by 10 minutes.

tier_2.name: Welcome Home
tier_2.description: Newly bought or born animals will start at 1 Heart Level.

tier_2.name: Discount Treats
tier_2.description: Heart shaped treats sold by Hayden will have a 10% price reduction.

tier_3.name: Currency of Care III
tier_3.description: Animals can now be fed cooked dishes and will reward more Shiny Beads based on the dish's star level.

tier_3.name: Welcome Home II
tier_3.description: Newly bought or born animals will start at 2 Heart Level.

tier_3.name: Barnyard Bounty II
tier_3.description: Ducks and Horses will sometimes drop extra Produce.

tier_3.name: Wind Down
tier_3.description: The Mill Time for all mill recipes will be reduced by 10 minutes.

tier_4.name: The Bell Tolls
tier_4.description: You will receive the Big Bell crafting recipe. When rung, the Big Bell calls out or sends in all animals into their buildings.

tier_4.name: Maximum Milling
tier_4.description: Crafting Animal Feeds at the mill will sometimes drop an additional item of the same kind.

tier_4.name: Barnyard Bounty III
tier_4.description: Sheep and Rabbits will sometimes drop extra Produce.

tier_1.name: Hammer Timing
tier_1.description: The Craft Time for all crafting recipes will be reduced by 10 minutes.

tier_1.name: Lumberjack
tier_1.description: Breaking a Branch will sometimes drop an extra piece of Wood.

tier_1.name: Masonry
tier_1.description: Breaking a Rock will sometimes drop an extra piece of Stone.

tier_1.name: Forager
tier_1.description: Chopping down a Tree will occasionally drop a seasonally appropriate Forageable.

tier_2.name: Working with the Grain
tier_2.description: Crafting an item will occasionally return one of its ingredients afterward.

tier_2.name: Quality Crafting
tier_2.description: Crafting an Item will occasionally result in a bonus Quality Infusion, which grants it a 10% higher selling price.

tier_2.name: Natural
tier_2.description: Chopping down any tree will occasionally drop Hardwood.

tier_2.name: Hammer Timing II
tier_2.description: The Craft Time for all crafting recipes will reduce by an additional 10 minutes, bringing the total reduction to 20 minutes.

tier_3.name: Material World
tier_3.description: Material drops from breakables in the Mines now drop twice as much.

tier_3.name: Steady Supplies
tier_3.description: Sod, Peat, and Cattails can now be purchased at the Carpenter's Shop.

tier_3.name: Set Pieces
tier_3.description: Crafting an item can occasionally give you two of it.

tier_3.name: Hammer Timing III
tier_3.description: The Craft Time for all crafting recipes will reduce by an additional 10 minutes, bringing the total reduction to 30 minutes.

tier_4.name: Lumberjack II
tier_4.description: Breaking a Branch, felling a tree, or chopping down a stump will always drop an extra piece of Wood.

tier_4.name: Underground Inspiration
tier_4.description: Coral and Crystals now drop materials twice as often.

tier_4.name: Deliberate Debris
tier_4.description: Farm debris will spawn 50% less often. This perk can be toggled on and off.

tier_1.name: Guardian's Shield
tier_1.description: Once per day, the first hit you take is nullified.

tier_1.name: True Strike
tier_1.description: Your Attacks will occasionally become Critical, doing double damage in the Mines.

tier_1.name: Jump Attack
tier_1.description: Jumping and then Attacking mid-air will damage enemies in a small radius.

tier_1.name: Well-Armed
tier_1.description: Biome-unique Armor and Weapons will sometimes drop from Treasure Chests in the Mines.

tier_2.name: Quick Footed
tier_2.description: Blue Sapling pools will grant a short Speed Boost rather than slow you down.

tier_2.name: What an Offer
tier_2.description: Using an Offering Shrine will bestow a short HP & Stamina Regen buff in addition to their usual effect.

tier_2.name: Generous In Defeat
tier_2.description: Monsters will occasionally drop twice as many items when defeated.

tier_2.name: Dungeon Delicacies
tier_2.description: Certain Cooked Dishes will occasionally drop from Treasure Chests in the Mines.

tier_3.name: Perfect Prefix
tier_3.description: The infusion power of Infused Weapons will double.

tier_3.name: Rocking
tier_3.description: Clod Projectiles that are reflected back are now much more likely to critically strike.

tier_3.name: In Motion
tier_3.description: Defeating a Monster will sometimes grant a brief Speed Boost.

tier_3.name: Out of Juice
tier_3.description: Enchanterns now briefly freeze in place after discharging.

tier_4.name: Sonic Boom
tier_4.description: If you attack the Essence Bat's sonic attack, unleash a Sonic Boom, damaging all enemies around you.

tier_4.name: Gift Exchange
tier_4.description: When you throw an item into a resting Mimic Chest, it will drop two items instead of one.

tier_1.name: Earth Breaker
tier_1.description: Breaking a Rock in the Mines will occasionally destroy all other Rocks in a 1x3 area around it.

tier_1.name: Ore-riginal
tier_1.description: Biome-Specific Ore will sometimes drop from Breaking Rocks in the Mines.

tier_1.name: Reclaimer
tier_1.description: Biome-Specific Furniture will sometimes drop from Treasure Chests in the Mines.

tier_1.name: Treasure Hunter
tier_1.description: Treasure Floors will sometimes appear in the Mines.

tier_2.name: Iron Hound
tier_2.description: Breaking an Iron Node will occasionally drop an extra piece of Iron.

tier_2.name: True Blue
tier_2.description: Breaking a Sapphire Node will occasionally drop an extra Sapphire.

tier_2.name: Treasured
tier_2.description: Treasure Chests will become more likely to appear in the Mines.

tier_2.name: Mine Time
tier_2.description: Movement Speed will increase for 10 seconds when you first enter a new Floor.

tier_3.name: Resonance
tier_3.description: Defeating an enemy can break a nearby rock.

tier_3.name: Earth Breaker II
tier_3.description: Breaking a Rock in the Mines will occasionally destroy all other Rocks in a 1x3 area around it and is now more likely to occur.

tier_3.name: Silver Seeker
tier_3.description: Breaking a Silver Node will occasionally drop an extra piece of Silver.

tier_3.name: Fantastic Finds
tier_3.description: You can no longer find Wooden Treasure Chests, and you are now more likely to find a higher tier of Treasure Chests.

tier_4.name: Lost to History
tier_4.description: Ritual Chamber Floors will sometimes appear in the Mines.

tier_4.name: Good as Gold
tier_4.description: Breaking a Gold Node will occasionally drop an extra piece of Gold.

tier_4.name: Refined Rockery
tier_4.description: The Craft Time for all Stone Refinery recipes will be reduced by 10 minutes.

tier_4.name: Break One, Get Two
tier_4.description: Crafting a recipe at the Stone Refinery will sometimes create a bonus crafted item.
